title: Shooting at Virginia Walmart Kills Six People; Assailant is also dead after shooting, police say
text:
"Our first responders are well-trained and prepared to respond; please give them space to do so," it said.

Leo Kosinski of the Chesapeake Police Department said officers responded to a report of a shooting at around 10:15 p.m., according to the Associated Press.

He said that over the course of about 35 to 40 minutes, police found multiple dead and injured people.

The city of Chesapeake said a news conference would be held at 8 a.m. on Wednesday.

Walmart said it was shocked at the tragic event. "We're praying for those impacted, the community and our associates," the retailer said in a tweet. "We're working closely with law enforcement, and we are focused on supporting our associates."

Chesapeake Mayor Rick W. West said the community has been shaken by the attack.

"I am devastated by the senseless act of violence that took place last night in our city. My prayers are with all those affectedâ€”the victims, their family, their friends and their co-workers," he said on Twitter. "I am grateful for the quick actions taken by our first responders who rushed to the scene."

The mass shooting is Virginia's second in less than two weeks. On Nov. 13, a gunman killed three people and injured two others on the University of Virginia campus in Charlottesville. A suspect, a UVA student, was taken into custody after a 13-hour manhunt.

Late Saturday, a gunman opened fire in a gay nightclub in Colorado Springs, Colo., killing five people and wounding an additional 19.

The suspect, Anderson Lee Aldrich, was arrested on murder and hate-crime charges in the massacre at Club Q, which was hosting a drag show. The club had planned a brunch for Sunday in honor of Transgender Day of Remembrance.

He is scheduled to make his first court appearance Wednesday.

Shooting at Virginia Walmart Kills Six People
